messages.message:
/me is seeing error from table-service (it fails to start)

```#12 10.52 [INFO] Changes detected - recompiling the module!
#12 10.52 [WARNING] File encoding has not been set, using platform encoding ANSI_X3.4-1968, i.e. build is platform dependent!
#12 10.52 [INFO] Compiling 138 source files to /table-tservice/target/classes
#12 12.14 [INFO] /table-tservice/target/generated-sources/protobuf/java/com/instabase/protos/tableservice/Connection.java: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
#12 12.14 [INFO] /table-tservice/target/generated-sources/protobuf/java/com/instabase/protos/tableservice/Connection.java: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
#12 12.14 [INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------
#12 12.14 [ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR : 
#12 12.14 [INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------
#12 12.14 [ERROR] /table-tservice/target/generated-sources/protobuf/java/com/instabase/protos/tableservice/ExecuteBatchReqOrBuilder.java:[6,8] duplicate class: com.instabase.protos.tableservice.ExecuteBatchReqOrBuilder
#12 12.14 [ERROR] /table-tservice/target/generated-sources/protobuf/java/com/instabase/protos/tableservice/CreateTableReq.java:[13,15] duplicate class: com.instabase.protos.tableservice.CreateTableReq
#12 12.14 [ERROR] /table-tservice/build/java/com/instabase/protos/tableservice/StatusCode.java:[9,8] duplicate class: com.instabase.protos.tableservice.StatusCode
#12 12.14 [ERROR] /table-tservice/target/generated-sources/protobuf/java/com/instabase/protos/tableservice/BaseType.java:[9,8] duplicate class: com.instabase.protos.tableservice.BaseType```

...and now core platform fails

```2025/07/16 18:55:49 ERROR coreplatformservice/repo/handler/handler.go:188 -- Fail: Error while retrieving user account
2025/07/16 18:55:49 level=ERROR path=utils/db/session/dbsession.go:619 msg="SQL DB: Error 1054 (42S22): Unknown column 'accounts.deleted_at' in 'field list'" operation=db/session/DBSessionImpl.Query query="SELECT `accounts`.`account_type` AS `accounts.account_type`, `accounts`.`deleted_at` AS `accounts.deleted_at`, `accounts`.`id` AS `accounts.id`, `accounts`.`metadata` AS `accounts.metadata`, `accounts`.`public_id` AS `accounts.public_id`, `accounts`.`registered_on` AS `accounts.registered_on`, `users`.`account_id` AS `users.account_id`, `users`.`deleted_at` AS `users.deleted_at`, `users`.`deletion_started_at` AS `users.deletion_started_at`, `users`.`email` AS `users.email`, `users`.`id` AS `users.id`, `users`.`is_active` AS `users.is_active`, `users`.`is_admin` AS `users.is_admin`, `users`.`is_approved` AS `users.is_approved`, `users`.`is_verified` AS `users.is_verified`, `users`.`metadata` AS `users.metadata`, `users`.`password` AS `users.password`, `users`.`pwd_reset_required` AS `users.pwd_reset_required`, `users`.`state` AS `users.state`, `users`.`type` AS `users.type` FROM `users`, `accounts` WHERE ((`account_id` = `accounts`.`id`) AND (`accounts`.`public_id` = ?))" query_type=select table=users trace_id=99785ec5e2fd0854```
ok, dbmigration helped... I'd be happy if migration for breaking changes would be more automatic
